dalserver
Class SiapServlet

java.lang.Object
  javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
          dalserver.SiapServlet
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig
public class SiapServlet
extends javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet

Generic HTTP Servlet for the SIAP protocol. By default this service merely implements a data query and returns a query response, but never finds any data. If properly configured, this generic SIAP class also has the ability to query a DBMS for image metadata, implementing a real SIAP service for "archival" data (whole images).

This is a generic HTTP servlet which implements an SIAP service using the service implementation provided by the generic SiapService class. By default it merely echoes its input arguments and defines and return an empty VOTable containing all predefined SIAP table fields. To turn this into a real data service, one can either configure it (in the servlet web.xml) to query a local DBMS to find archival image data, or subclass the service to implement a custom SIAP service.

To implement a custom service (in src/dataServices) one would 1) subclass SiapService and modify it as necessary to query a real data collection, and 2) subclass this class (SiapServlet) and override the newSiapService method to call the custom SiapService class provided in step 1). The modified Servlet class should then be runnable in any compliant Java application server such as Apache Tomcat.

See Also:

Field Detail

serviceName

protected java.lang.String serviceName
The name of the service or servlet instance. This is used to construct file names for service-specific configuration files. For example, if we have two different SIA service instances these should have distinct service names. Defined locally in the servlet deployment descriptor (web.xml). Optional.

serviceVersion

protected java.lang.String serviceVersion
The default service interface version supported by the service if no version number is explicitly negotiated. This is usually the highest standard interface version supported by the service. Defined locally in the servlet deployment descriptor (web.xml).

configDir

protected java.lang.String configDir
The directory on the local server machine used to store runtime service configuration files, e.g., for the getCapabilities method. Defined locally in the servlet deployment descriptor (web.xml).

dataDirURL

protected java.lang.String dataDirURL
A directory (referenced by URL) on the local server machine used to store precomputed archival datasets to be returned by the built-in getData method. Most services will require a more sophisticated means to return data, but this technique is provided to provide a simple built-in getData capability for testing. Defined locally in the servlet deployment descriptor (web.xml). Optional.

contentType

protected java.lang.String contentType
The content (MIME) type to be used for any datasets retrieved from the dataDir. If set to DYNAMIC, the service will attempt to dynamically determine the content type of each file.

dbType

protected java.lang.String dbType
The type of database to be accessed, e.g., "MySQL", "PostgreSQL", or "builtin". For the most part JDBC hides the difference between DBMS implementations, but not entirely.

dbName

protected java.lang.String dbName
The name of the database to be accessed. By "database" we mean a SQL catalog or schema containing tables.

tableName

protected java.lang.String tableName
The name of the table to be accessed by the SCS service.

jdbcUrl

protected java.lang.String jdbcUrl
The JDBC URL of the database server, e.g., "jdbc:mysql://:3306/".

jdbcDriver

protected java.lang.String jdbcDriver
The address of the JDBC driver to be used, e.g., "com.mysql.jdbc.Driver".

dbUser

protected java.lang.String dbUser
The user name to be used to login to the DBMS.

dbPassword

protected java.lang.String dbPassword
The password to be used to login to the DBMS. This should not be a real user password, but rather the password of a DBMS account used to provide low security, read-only access the database.

newSiapService

public SiapService newSiapService(SiapParamSet params)
Get a new SiapService instance. By default the generic dataless SiapService class is used. To build a real data service, subclass SiapServlet and replace the newSiapService method with one which calls a custom replacement for the builtin generic SiapService class.

This version includes the dataDir and dataType parameters, used to implement a simple mechanism (see SiapService.getData(dalserver.SiapParamSet, dalserver.RequestResponse) for returning static precomputed archival files from local storage on the server.

Parameters:
params - The input and service parameters.
